title: Department of Physical and Technical Problems of Steel Metallurgy

firstPersonCard.name: Molchanov Lavr Serhiiovych
firstPersonCard.researchDirection: Theory and practice of converter processes, development of new and improvement of existing technologies and equipment for steel production in the areas of saving energy and material resources, improving quality.

items: Theory and practice of converter processes.
Theory and technology of high-temperature modeling of converter bath blowing and ladle refining of pig iron.
Resource and energy saving along the technological route of steel production: blast furnace - oxygen converter.
Development, research and implementation of the latest resource- and energy-efficient methods for influencing thermophysical, gas-dynamic and refining processes in the steelmaking bath.

Search for solutions to increase the efficiency of secondary steel treatment methods and improve steel casting processes by improving the conditions for using alloying, deoxidizing, heat-insulating and refining additive materials based on improving their technological properties.

Development of proposals and justification for non-standard compositions of micro-alloying and refining compositions, formation of recommendations for the use of associated substandard ferroalloy production by-products.

Determination and utilization of features of the hydrodynamic and thermal state of the ladle metal bath during steel treatment on ladle-furnace units, vacuum degassers of various types and other secondary treatment equipment, including through identified patterns and leverage for influencing ongoing processes to improve metal quality, manufactured metal products and reduce material costs at these stages of steel production.

Justification of the rational location of the bottom blowing unit relative to the points of introduction of lump and wire additives in steel casting ladles of different capacity and bath geometry; determination of energy-saving blowing, heating, steel casting regimes, etc.
